title: Malaysia's Mahathir says crimes committed by previous government will be investigated
text:
KUALA LUMPUR (Reuters) - Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said on Monday he would appoint a new chief of the countryâ€™s anti-graft agency and that all alleged crimes committed by previous government would be investigated.
Malaysia's newly elected Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad attends a news conference in Menara Yayasan Selangor, Pataling Jaya, Malaysia May 12, 2018. REUTERS/Stringer Addressing a news conference, the 92-year-old Mahathir said all government ministries had been instructed that no documents could be taken out or destroyed.
Reporting by Joseph Sipalan, Editing by Raju Gopalakrishnan
Our Standards: The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles.
